title: Presiding in House of Representatives

content.text: There shall preside at any sitting of the House of Representatives -
(b) in the absence of the Speaker, the Deputy Speaker; or
(c) in the absence of the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker, such member of the House (not being a Minister or a Parliamentary Secretary) as the House may elect for that purpose.

notes: This article establishes the hierarchy for presiding over sittings of the House of Representatives, starting with the Speaker, followed by the Deputy Speaker, and in their absence, a member elected by the House who is not a Minister or Parliamentary Secretary.
